availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, captain and assistant quarter master. Mason County, Kentucky native. Married to Sally Theobald Sayres. Father of Adaline Sayres, Ella Sayres, and Lucy Sayres. Merchant clerk in Franklin County, Kentucky in 1850. Clerk in Frankfort in 1860. Appointed assistant quartermaster and captain for Kentucky State Troops on March 13, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 55B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 109.
“Sayres,” The Frankfort Roundabout, August 4, 1906.
